messages.message: @dlluncor https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10486/files -- does this mean what i think it means?!
we can start moving our dockers to python 3??!
oh wait, i guess we would still set USE_PY3 to false in prod, but we can locally test with USE_PY3=true

Also, I’m currently in the middle of a large PR to convert all python services over to be able to `USE_PY3=true` during `make build-docker`. Got the first one merged yesterday, should have the rest done today or tomorrow.
:clap:

Hey @Handsome Dave that's awesome! If you look at my PRs you'll notice I made a change to nbconvert version.

If you could check the history on those dockerfiles and make sure there are no other changes, want to make sure we are propogating some version changes we are making to certain libraries
@lydia been making some progress on PY3. I'll let you and the team know what you can do to make your services PY3 ready -- working on standardizing a few things still
Sorry, I’m not sure I follow. As long as I’m pulling from master, I should be up to date wrt the Dockerfiles, right?
True yes should be fine, you
Might get merge conflicts you have to resolve
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10500 for anyone who wants to take a gander
@dlluncor i think your PR https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10486/files breaks deploys
build-py is a make command that only exists in file-tservice and ocr-services, so when you added it to build-pthon.mk (http://build-pthon.mk), it's breaking all other python services
(discovered because i'm trying to push to sandbox)
yes can you fix, it should be “build” not “build-py”
oh i see @Handsome Dave fixed it in his PR
Yeah. We could fix it in a separate quick PR if necessary. I know mine is fairly involved.
that's ok, i can wait. i'll just edit it locally for now

I’m not sure what you want me to test with the pushes. That I can still push a docker image built on python 2? Or do you want me to push one built on python 3? Either way, nothing I did should have touched/changed anything with that process.
yup - for example, david's previous PR broke that command
so i would just double-check that we can still build and push images
:thumbsup:

just to unblock you here @lydia — submitted the fix to the Makefile breakage I created: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10510

David reviewing your Docker change now!

FYI we also updated requests and urllib3 due to security vulnerabilities that we needed to ship — that’s the last change that I needed to make for this push — thanks! Should be the last merge conflict
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10487
@Handsome Dave
Got it!
PR updated
nice! — sent my comments
Changes pushed
